level.heading: Termination of custodianship.
level.text: The custodian shall transfer in an appropriate manner the custodial property to the minor or to the minor's estate upon the earlier of:

The minor reaches 18 years of age, or if the transfer was made as provided in section 21-309(d), the minor reaches 21 years of age, with respect to custodial property transferred under section 21-304 or 21-305;
The minor reaches 18 years of age with respect to custodial property transferred under section 21-306 or 21-307; or

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: D.C. Law 13-292, in par. (1), inserted ", or if the transfer was made as provided in section 21-309(d), the minor reaches 21 years of age," following "18 years of age".
